text: <@U7SL518D6> so if i submitted a email template today, how many days i can assume to be approved, as after 08/17 to now, its very long period of waiting
and is it okay to submit multiple templates at a time to be reviewed ?

I can’t give any timeframes, I’m not a HS employee,  but <@U22PKFRU5> may be able to give more info. I know that the amount of time it’s taking for reviews is something they are actively working to improve.

Yes it’s fine to submit multiple templates at a time.

(thanks for the mention <@U7SL518D6> :raised_hands:)  - - HI <@UCH1L597V> ... the goal we're trying to get to is 24 hour turn around time.... BUT, at this moment in time... we're far from that right now. I'd estimate 7-10 business days.

The reason there is a delay is because we manually check every single item submitted to the marketplace (check it meets guidelines, try to break it, stress test it, make sure it's marketer friendly,etc). This is a very manual process, however, it ensures we hold a high standard of good quality items in the marketplace.

I know we've been getting a flood of new submissions since opening the marketplace to offer Custom Modules -and- as Jon mentioned above, the manager was out of office for INBOUND and then his wedding+honeymoon. So there's a bit more of a delay right now. Appreciate your patience!! :pray:
If you don't hear back by the end of the week - please slack/email me with both your information and the submission... and I'll do some hunting to see what's up.

I am curious, how do y’all arrange your portal file structures to push to the marketplace and keep other templates separate? Maybe a better question is how do you design your file structures in your main HubSpot portal?
We have a marketplace folder with projects subfolders with website pages, landing pages, custom modules and email folders… :upside_down_face:
